titleText: In 1973, An Arson Killed 32 People At A Gay Bar. For Years, It Was Forgotten
teaserText: It was 45 years ago this Sunday that one of the worst attacks on LGBTQ Americans left 32 people dead. For decades, homophobia led many to ignore the tragedy.

titleText: Saudi Arabia Lifts Ban On Women Drivers
Tweeting Oncologist Draws Ire And Admiration For Calling Out Hype
Political 'Counterculture': Young Republicans Hold Unique Space In The Trump Era
Donald Hall, Former Poet Laureate, Dies At 89
teaserText: Hall, the author of more than 40 books, died on Saturday at his family farm in the town of Wilmot, N.H.

titleText: Sarah Sanders Joins List Of Top Trump Aides Confronted At Restaurants
teaserText: The White House press secretary was asked to leave a Va. restaurant Friday. Earlier this week, DHS secretary Kirstjen Nielsen and White House adviser Stephen Miller were heckled at restaurants.

titleText: Analysis Finds Geographic Overlap In Opioid Use And Trump Support In 2016
teaserText: Counties with higher rates of opioid use skewed heavily Republican in the 2016 election. What role did the opioid epidemic play in President Trump's victory?

titleText: Muslim Sex Educators Forge Their Own #MeToo Movement
teaserText: #MeToo has given voice to victims of sexual harassment, including in religious communities. Among Muslims, a group of young people is creating its own movement to address abuse.

titleText: A Global Guide For Leery Travelers
teaserText: Is your destination too dangerous? How do you protect yourself from health threats?

titleText: The Hypocrisy Of Eating At Mexican Restaurants
teaserText: In the past week, two of the most vocal advocates for the Trump administration's "zero-tolerance" immigration policy were heckled while eating at Mexican restaurants in Washington.

titleText: Priscilla Renea Refuses To Be Quiet About Racism In Country Music
teaserText: Dolly Parton, one of Renea's favorite singers, says you have to stay quiet to make it in show business. But Renea refuses to downplay her experiences as a black woman in country music.

titleText: A Cornucopia Of Comic Artists Pay Homage To Michael Chabon's Escapist
teaserText: Chabon created the Escapist for his 2000 novel The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay — but now he's become a real comic hero, his exploits drawn by equally legendary figures such as Will Eisner.

titleText: The Bountiful Benefits Of Bringing Back The Beavers
teaserText: Hundreds of millions of beavers used to populate the West but were hunted to near extinction. Turns out, beavers are critical to healthy water ecosystems, so now there are efforts to bring them back.

titleText: U.S. And South Korea Agree To Suspend Upcoming Military Exercises Indefinitely
teaserText: The announcement of additional suspensions follows the summit between President Trump and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un earlier this month.

titleText: Animated History: The Evolution Of Parenting
teaserText: A new theory claims that sharing — first of child care and food, but later more complex things — were the original secrets of our species' success.

titleText: Migrants Are Stuck In Mexico With Violence Back Home And 'Zero Tolerance' In The U.S.
teaserText: As migrants and asylum-seekers decide whether to risk the effects of the Trump administration's "zero tolerance" immigration policy, Mexico's role as a possible destination for Central Americans has grown more important.

titleText: Last Year, A Retired Mexican Schoolteacher Vanished. His Family Still Seeks Answers
3 Charts That Show What's Actually Happening Along The Southern Border
teaserText: The number of people taken into custody at the southern U.S. border with Mexico has been decreasing since 2000. Economists say the reasons people choose to cross the border illegally are changing.

titleText: What We Know: Family Separation And 'Zero Tolerance' At The Border
Zimbabwe's President Emmerson Mnangagwa Unharmed After Explosion At Campaign Rally
teaserText: State-run newspaper The Herald is calling the incident an assassination attempt on Mnangagwa. The 75-year-old head of state had just left the stage when the blast occurred, injuring many.

titleText: Robert Mugabe, Zimbabwe's Longtime President, Resigns After Tumultuous Week
Who Is Zimbabwe's New Leader, Emmerson Mnangagwa?
France's World Cup Team Brings Positive Attention To Suburban Fans
teaserText: Eight of France's World Cup team come from the suburbs of big cities — non-white areas known for poverty. France won in 1998 with a multi-ethnic team, bringing hope, but not much has changed since.

titleText: PHOTOS: World Cup Brings Sunny Vibes To The Streets Of Senegal
'A Very English Scandal' Stars Who Else But A Very English Hugh Grant
teaserText: Grant plays popular progressive Jeremy Thorpe in the TV miniseries coming soon to Amazon. Thorpe's political career ended in the 1970s after an ex-lover accused him of an affair and a murder plot.

titleText: Hugh Grant On Smart Romantic Comedies And Standing Up To The Tabloids
How Hugh Grant Wants To Make You Rethink Tabloid Culture
